required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Gait After Dysport Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Video and Temporal Spatial Parameters Assessment of Gait After Dysport Treatment. A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study will aim to understand the potential benefit of the assessment of walking using video slow motion for muscle selection and the development of an image catalogue guide of the potential results of injection of abobotulinumtoxinA by comparing foot postures before and after injection. The objective is to evaluate the use of video assessment to improve muscle selection for the injection of botulinum toxin A to improve walking outcomes. Primary outcomes include: self-selected velocity (SSV), maximal velocity (MV) and symmetry of walking. Secondary outcomes include: passive range of motion (PROM), Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) and the Tardieu Scale (TS). Fifteen persons post stroke or TBI over age 18 with equinovarus foot deformity who are able to ambulate will be included in the study. Dysport 1000 to 1500 units will be used to be distributed on the basis of clinical indication to ankle plantar flexors (gastrocnemius and soleus), tibialis posterior and long toe flexors. The duration of subjects' participation is 4-6 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, single arm, non-randomized clinical study with pre-post assessment to include post-stroke and Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) outpatients with spastic ankle / foot muscles amenable to botulinum toxin injection. Subjects must be able to walk without braces.
AbobotulinumtoxinA injection in a dose range of 500 to 1500 units one time to be distributed on the basis of clinical indication to ankle plantar flexors (gastrocnemius and soleus), knee extensors, knee flexors, tibialis posterior and long toe flexors.

primary_outcome.description: Baseline and follow-up SSV with and without shoes. Distance covers over time at self selected pace. Larger value is better.
Baseline and follow-up MV with and without shoes. Distance covers over time when walking as fast as possible. Larger value is better.

primary_outcome.measure: Step-length at Baseline and at Follow-up (Temporal-spatial Data)
primary_outcome.description: Step length measured as the distance between the heel contact point of one foot and that of the other foot. Values are reported on the involved side. Larger values represent better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) at Baseline and at Follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Passive range of ankle in 1 second with knee flexed and knee extended. Scale of 0-4 (0: no increase in muscle tone; 1: Slight increase in muscle tone, manifested by a catch and release or by minimal resistance at the end of the range of motion when the affected part(s) is moved in flexion or extension; 1+:Slight increase in muscle tone, manifested by a catch, followed by minimal resistance throughout the remainder (less than half) of the ROM (range of movement); 2: More marked increase in muscle tone through most of the ROM, but affect part(s) easily moved; 3: Considerable increase in muscle tone passive, movement difficult; 4: Affected part(s) rigid in flexion or extension. 0-4 (Min-Max) Higher scores represents increase abnormal tone.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tardieu Scale (TS) at Baseline and at Follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of spastic response when passively ranging the ankle joint at very slow and very fast velocities with knee flexed and knee extended. Quality of muscle reaction (scored 0-4). 0 is no resistance to passive ROM to 4 indicating joint is immobile.

secondary_outcome.measure: Passive Range of Motion (PROM) at Baseline and at Follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Normal ranges of ankle dorsiflexion 0 to 30 degrees with knee flexed. Normal ranges of dorsiflexion 0 to 15 degrees with knee extended. Higher values in dorsiflexion range represent a better outcome.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive 1000 to 1500 units of Dysport to be distributed on the basis of clinical indication to ankle plantar flexors (gastrocnemius and soleus), knee extensors and flexors, tibialis posterior and long toe flexors for one injection.

intervention.description: Dysport 1000 to 1500 units to be distributed on the basis of clinical indication to ankle plantar flexors (gastrocnemius and soleus), knee extensors and flexors, tibialis posterior and long toe flexors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provide signed and dated informed consent form
- Willing to comply with all study procedures and be available for the duration of the study
- Male or female, aged ≥ 18
- Equinovarus foot deformity appropriate for botulinum toxin treatment (naïve or non-naïve)
- Modified Ashworth Scale between 1 to 3
- Women of reproductive potential must use effective contraception for the duration of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to walk without leg brace
- Previous surgical intervention to affected/ankle/foot
- Uncontrolled seizures
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Known allergic reactions to Dysport
- Treatment with another investigational drug or other intervention in the past 4 months
- Modified Ashworth Scale 4
- Anything that would place the individual at increased risk or preclude the individual's full compliance with or completion of the study
- Lower motor neuron disorder
- < Four months post botulinum toxin or serial casting

responsible_party.investigator_title: Chairman of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

baseline.population: Post-stroke and TBI outpatients with spastic ankle / foot muscles amenable to botulinum toxin injection.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Self-Selected Velocity (SSV)
outcome.description: Baseline and follow-up SSV with and without shoes. Distance covers over time at self selected pace. Larger value is better.

group.title: Barefoot SSV
group.description: SSV reported in participants walking barefoot.

group.title: Shoes SSV
group.description: SSV reported in participants walking in shoes.

measure.title: Self-Selected Velocity (SSV)
measure.description: Baseline and follow-up SSV with and without shoes. Distance covers over time at self selected pace. Larger value is better.

outcome.title: Maximal Velocity
outcome.description: Baseline and follow-up MV with and without shoes. Distance covers over time when walking as fast as possible. Larger value is better.

group.title: Barefoot MV
group.description: MV reported in participants walking barefoot.

group.title: Shoes MV
group.description: MV reported in participants walking in shoes.

measure.title: Maximal Velocity
measure.description: Baseline and follow-up MV with and without shoes. Distance covers over time when walking as fast as possible. Larger value is better.

outcome.title: Step-length at Baseline and at Follow-up (Temporal-spatial Data)
outcome.description: Step length measured as the distance between the heel contact point of one foot and that of the other foot. Values are reported on the involved side. Larger values represent better outcome.

group.title: Barefoot Step-Length
group.description: Step-length reported in participants walking barefoot.

group.title: Shoes Step-Length
group.description: Step-length reported in participants walking in shoes.

measure.title: Step-length at Baseline and at Follow-up (Temporal-spatial Data)
measure.description: Step length measured as the distance between the heel contact point of one foot and that of the other foot. Values are reported on the involved side. Larger values represent better outcome.

outcome.title: Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) at Baseline and at Follow-up
outcome.description: Passive range of ankle in 1 second with knee flexed and knee extended. Scale of 0-4 (0: no increase in muscle tone; 1: Slight increase in muscle tone, manifested by a catch and release or by minimal resistance at the end of the range of motion when the affected part(s) is moved in flexion or extension; 1+:Slight increase in muscle tone, manifested by a catch, followed by minimal resistance throughout the remainder (less than half) of the ROM (range of movement); 2: More marked increase in muscle tone through most of the ROM, but affect part(s) easily moved; 3: Considerable increase in muscle tone passive, movement difficult; 4: Affected part(s) rigid in flexion or extension. 0-4 (Min-Max) Higher scores represents increase abnormal tone.

group.title: MAS Ankle Knee Flexed
group.description: Change in ankle knee flexion MAS score

group.title: MAS Ankle Knee Extended
group.description: Change in ankle knee extension MAS score

measure.title: Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) at Baseline and at Follow-up
measure.description: Passive range of ankle in 1 second with knee flexed and knee extended. Scale of 0-4 (0: no increase in muscle tone; 1: Slight increase in muscle tone, manifested by a catch and release or by minimal resistance at the end of the range of motion when the affected part(s) is moved in flexion or extension; 1+:Slight increase in muscle tone, manifested by a catch, followed by minimal resistance throughout the remainder (less than half) of the ROM (range of movement); 2: More marked increase in muscle tone through most of the ROM, but affect part(s) easily moved; 3: Considerable increase in muscle tone passive, movement difficult; 4: Affected part(s) rigid in flexion or extension. 0-4 (Min-Max) Higher scores represents increase abnormal tone.

outcome.title: Tardieu Scale (TS) at Baseline and at Follow-up
outcome.description: Measurement of spastic response when passively ranging the ankle joint at very slow and very fast velocities with knee flexed and knee extended. Quality of muscle reaction (scored 0-4). 0 is no resistance to passive ROM to 4 indicating joint is immobile.

group.title: TS Ankle Knee Flexed Spasticity Grade
group.description: Participants were measured by the muscles' responses to stretch at given velocities.

group.title: TS Ankle Knee Extended Spasticity Grade
group.description: Participants were measured by the muscles' responses to stretch at given velocities.

measure.title: Tardieu Scale (TS) at Baseline and at Follow-up
measure.description: Measurement of spastic response when passively ranging the ankle joint at very slow and very fast velocities with knee flexed and knee extended. Quality of muscle reaction (scored 0-4). 0 is no resistance to passive ROM to 4 indicating joint is immobile.

outcome.title: Passive Range of Motion (PROM) at Baseline and at Follow-up
outcome.description: Normal ranges of ankle dorsiflexion 0 to 30 degrees with knee flexed. Normal ranges of dorsiflexion 0 to 15 degrees with knee extended. Higher values in dorsiflexion range represent a better outcome.
outcome.population: Clinician moved the ankle at flexion or extension with no effort from the participant.

group.title: PROM Ankle Knee Flexed
group.description: PROM measured at ankle knee flexed.

group.title: PROM Ankle Knee Extended
group.description: PROM measured at ankle knee extended.

measure.title: Passive Range of Motion (PROM) at Baseline and at Follow-up
measure.description: Normal ranges of ankle dorsiflexion 0 to 30 degrees with knee flexed. Normal ranges of dorsiflexion 0 to 15 degrees with knee extended. Higher values in dorsiflexion range represent a better outcome.
measure.population: Clinician moved the ankle at flexion or extension with no effort from the participant.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event was collected at follow-up (4-6 weeks) after the baseline visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
